intro: Hermannia pallens, commonly known as the white hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features upright, branching stems and produces clusters of small, white flowers with prominent yellow stamens. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Hermannia pallens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
